title: Frederick Douglass National Historic Site: Multimedia Presentations
body: Multimedia Presentations        Videos                        Cedar Hill: Then and Now Images of Cedar Hill from Douglass's time and the present  Duration:4 minutes, 14 seconds                                Close Encounters: The Educated Bears A bear visits the dentist.  Duration:1 minute, 53 seconds                                Close Encounters: John Greenleaf Whittier, "The Slave's Poet" A look at the home of John Greenleaf Whittier, whom Frederick Douglass called "The Slave's Poet."  Duration:2 minutes, 6 seconds               Oratorical Contest Videos                       Brent Wood: 1st Place Grades 1-3 Brent Wood, winner of the Elementary Division (Grades 1-3), 2012 Frederick Douglass Oratorical Contest.  Duration:2 minutes, 55 seconds                                Brayden Wood: 1st Place Grades 4-5 Brayden Wood, winner of the Junior Division (Grades 4-5), 2012 Frederick Douglass Oratorical Contest  Duration:3 minutes, 46 seconds                                Campbell McDade-Clay: 1st Place Grades 6-8 Campbell McDade-Clay, winner of the Junior High Division (Grades 6-8), 2012 Frederick Douglass Oratorical Contest.  Duration:6 minutes, 55 seconds                                Danielle Forehand: 1st Place Grades 9-12 Danielle Forehand, winner of the Senior Division (Grades 9-12), 2012 Frederick Douglass Oratorical Contest.  Duration:6 minutes, 55 seconds                     Frederick Douglass: The Unbelievable True Story of a Brave and Inspirational Man      A podcast covering Frederick Douglass's life.  Duration:6 minutes, 28 seconds      Credit / Author: Anna M., Burgundy Farm Country Day School, class of 2012. Based on the book "The Frederick Douglass you never knew."
